verses.kjv: In the tenth year, in the tenth month, in the twelfth day of the month, the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.ct: On the 12th day of the 10th month, in the 10th year, a message from the LORD came to me:

verses.kjv: Son of man, set thy face against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and prophesy against him, and against all Egypt:
verses.ct: "Son of man, turn against Pharaoh king of Egypt and prophesy against him and against all of Egypt.

verses.kjv: Speak, and say, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I am against thee, Pharaoh king of Egypt, the great dragon that lieth in the midst of his rivers, which hath said, My river is mine own, and I have made it for myself.
verses.ct: Speak to him and say: This is what the Lord GOD declares — Pay attention, I am against you, Pharaoh king of Egypt, you great monster lying in the middle of your rivers, who has said, 'The Nile is mine — I made it for myself.'

verses.kjv: But I will put hooks in thy jaws, and I will cause the fish of thy rivers to stick unto thy scales, and I will bring thee up out of the midst of thy rivers, and all the fish of thy rivers shall stick unto thy scales.
verses.ct: But I will put hooks in your jaws and make the fish of your rivers cling to your scales. I will drag you up out of the middle of your rivers, with all the fish of your rivers stuck to your scales.

verses.kjv: And I will leave thee thrown into the wilderness, thee and all the fish of thy rivers: thou shalt fall upon the open fields; thou shalt not be brought together, nor gathered: I have given thee for meat to the beasts of the field and to the fowls of the heaven.
verses.ct: I will throw you out into the desert, you and all the fish of your rivers. You will land on the open ground, never to be collected or picked up. I have given you as food to the wild animals and the birds of the heavens.

verses.kjv: And all the inhabitants of Egypt shall know that I am the LORD, because they have been a staff of reed to the house of Israel.
verses.ct: Then everyone living in Egypt will recognize that I am the LORD. This is because Egypt has been nothing but a flimsy reed staff to the people of Israel.

verses.kjv: When they took hold of thee by thy hand, thou didst break, and rend all their shoulder: and when they leaned upon thee, thou brakest, and madest all their loins to be at a stand.
verses.ct: When they grabbed hold of you, you snapped and tore open their shoulders. When they leaned on you, you broke apart and made their legs give out.

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I will bring a sword upon thee, and cut off man and beast out of thee.
verses.ct: So this is what the Lord GOD declares: Look, I am bringing a sword against you, and I will cut off both people and animals from you.

verses.kjv: And the land of Egypt shall be desolate and waste; and they shall know that I am the LORD: because he hath said, The river is mine, and I have made it.
verses.ct: The land of Egypt will become an empty wasteland, and they will recognize that I am the LORD. Because Pharaoh said, 'The Nile is mine, and I made it,'

verses.kjv: Behold, therefore I am against thee, and against thy rivers, and I will make the land of Egypt utterly waste and desolate, from the tower of Syene even unto the border of Ethiopia.
verses.ct: I am therefore against you and against your rivers. I will turn the land of Egypt into a complete and total wasteland, from Migdol to Syene, all the way to the border of Ethiopia.

verses.kjv: No foot of man shall pass through it, nor foot of beast shall pass through it, neither shall it be inhabited forty years.
verses.ct: No human foot will travel through it, and no animal will pass through it. It will remain uninhabited for 40 years.

verses.kjv: And I will make the land of Egypt desolate in the midst of the countries that are desolate, and her cities among the cities that are laid waste shall be desolate forty years: and I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and will disperse them through the countries.
verses.ct: I will make the land of Egypt desolate among other desolate nations, and its cities will lie in ruins among other ruined cities for 40 years. I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them across foreign lands.

verses.kjv: Yet thus saith the Lord GOD; At the end of forty years will I gather the Egyptians from the people whither they were scattered:
verses.ct: Yet this is what the Lord GOD declares: After 40 years, I will gather the Egyptians from the nations where they were scattered.

verses.kjv: And I will bring again the captivity of Egypt, and will cause them to return into the land of Pathros, into the land of their habitation; and they shall be there a base kingdom.
verses.ct: I will restore the fortunes of Egypt and bring them back to the land of Pathros, the land where they came from. There they will be a minor kingdom.

verses.kjv: It shall be the basest of the kingdoms; neither shall it exalt itself any more above the nations: for I will diminish them, that they shall no more rule over the nations.
verses.ct: It will be the least significant of all kingdoms and will never again rise above the other nations. I will reduce them so that they will never again dominate other nations.

verses.kjv: And it shall be no more the confidence of the house of Israel, which bringeth their iniquity to remembrance, when they shall look after them: but they shall know that I am the Lord GOD.
verses.ct: Egypt will never again be a source of confidence for the people of Israel. Instead, it will be a reminder of Israel's sin in turning to Egypt for help. Then they will recognize that I am the Lord GOD."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the seven and twentieth year, in the first month, in the first day of the month, the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.ct: On the 1st day of the 1st month, in the 27th year, a message from the LORD came to me:

verses.kjv: Son of man, Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon caused his army to serve a great service against Tyrus: every head was made bald, and every shoulder was peeled: yet had he no wages, nor his army, for Tyrus, for the service that he had served against it:
verses.ct: "Son of man, King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon drove his army through an exhausting campaign against Tyre. Every soldier's head was rubbed raw and every shoulder was worn bare. Yet neither he nor his army received any reward from Tyre for all the effort they put into the siege.

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I will give the land of Egypt unto Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon; and he shall take her multitude, and take her spoil, and take her prey; and it shall be the wages for his army.
verses.ct: So this is what the Lord GOD declares: Look, I am giving the land of Egypt to King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon. He will carry off its wealth, seize its plunder, and strip its riches — and that will serve as payment for his army.

verses.kjv: I have given him the land of Egypt for his labour wherewith he served against it, because they wrought for me, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.ct: I have given him the land of Egypt as compensation for the work he did against Tyre, because he and his army were carrying out my purposes," declares the Lord GOD.

verses.kjv: In that day will I cause the horn of the house of Israel to bud forth, and I will give thee the opening of the mouth in the midst of them; and they shall know that I am the LORD.
verses.ct: "On that day, I will cause new strength to spring up for the people of Israel, and I will open your mouth to speak among them. Then they will recognize that I am the LORD."
